intro: Leichhardtia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, fleshy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers arranged in a cluster at the end of each stem. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Leichhardtia spathulata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
